projectDesc.p: To the tune “The Moon Over the West River”—"Pingshan Hall"is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “The Moon Over the West River”—"Pingshan Hall"
By the time I stopped by the Pingshan Hall for the third time,
Half of my lifetime had gone in a flick of the finger.
For ten years I have not seen the old immortal,
On the walls, dragons fly and serpents move.
I want to commemorate the Prefect of Fine Composition,
I still sing the song for the willows and the spring breeze.
Do not say that all things become empty in a blink of an eye.
Even before your eyes blink, it is all just a dream.
